rationale: Remove line-break artifact and retain correct hyphenation for a compound modifier before a noun per Bellwether/AP style.
Ensure one space after a sentence period before endnote marker per Chicago endnote formatting and Bellwether guideline of one space after sentences.
No change to wording; flag to confirm style. Hyphenation is correct for compound adjectives before a noun; leaving as-is but noting check is not needed.

original_text: Delaware Pathways are offered in every Delaware district
suggested_edit: Delaware Pathways is offered in every Delaware district
rationale: Program name used as a singular collective entity should take a singular verb for clarity and consistency in formal publications.

original_text:
as eight charter schools and two schools for at-risk
                                                     [sidebar] Delaware Pathways
youth in the custody of the Delaware Department
suggested_edit:
as eight charter schools and two schools for at-risk youth in the custody of the Delaware Department

[Sidebar callout to be formatted separately in layout]
rationale: Remove inline sidebar marker and fix broken sentence caused by layout artifacts; keep content intact while indicating sidebar should be handled in design.

Bellwether exception specifies SY should be written as SY23-24 on later mentions; this appears to be first mention in the sidebar, but the body already uses SY format elsewhere. Align to exception for consistency.
Standardize placeholder notation and remove extraneous angle brackets/spaces; flag to replace with final title before publication.

original_text:
3. Ensuring students’ preparation for
       Delaware Pathways’ rigor
suggested_edit: 3. Ensuring students are prepared for Delaware Pathways’ rigor
rationale: Improve clarity and maintain parallel gerund phrase structure across list items; avoids awkward possessive construction.

issue: Smart quotes and spacing before endnote
rationale: Per Chicago endnote style, the note number typically follows the punctuation without an extra space; ensure consistency with endnote placement.
Replace incorrect straight/backwards apostrophe with proper curly apostrophe for possessive per typographic conventions.
Correct corporate name capitalization; DuPont uses internal capital P.
Use “low-skill” to align with later uses of “middle-skill” and “high-skill” describing job categories; ‘skilled’ implies worker skill rather than job classification.

original_text: Jobs for the Future (JFF), to launch
suggested_edit: Jobs for the Future (JFF) to launch
rationale: Remove unnecessary comma splitting subject and infinitive; improves flow.
AP style prefers “coauthor” as one word; however, usage varies. Align with AP for publication.
Spell out numbers one through nine per Bellwether/AP style in narrative text.
Avoid “&” unless part of a formal name; pathway names are not formal entities and should use “and.”

original_text: manufacturing, computer science & IT, engineering, and finance
suggested_edit: manufacturing, computer science and IT, engineering, and finance
rationale: Replace ampersand with “and” to align with style; retain Oxford comma.

original_text: support Delaware Pathways (Led by the Delaware Workforce Development Board).
suggested_edit: support Delaware Pathways. (Led by the Delaware Workforce Development Board.)
rationale: Parenthetical lead attribution reads as a sentence fragment; better as a separate sentence within parentheses for clarity.
Ensure consistent endnote formatting; typically no space before superscript/endnote number.
For publication accessibility and clarity, replace symbols with text in tables unless design will handle icons; improves screen reader compatibility.
No change; AP now allows % sign. This is a confirmation note; no edit needed.

original_text:
Concentrator: measured by the
                                                               number of students who completed
                                                               least two pathways courses
suggested_edit: Concentrator: measured by the number of students who completed at least two pathways courses

original_text: English Language Learners are the most underrepresented,
suggested_edit: English learners (ELs) are the most underrepresented,

original_text: Completers with disabilities fall 9 percentage points below their enrollment rate (17% versus 8%).
suggested_edit: Completers with disabilities fall 9 percentage points below their enrollment rate (8% versus 17%).
rationale: Correct the order to reflect ‘completers’ percentage compared to enrollment; as written, the parenthetical reverses the comparison.

issue: Comma before conjunction in series of examples
original_text: manufacturing, computer science & IT, engineering, and finance
suggested_edit: manufacturing, computer science and IT, engineering, and finance
rationale: Replace ampersand with “and” per style; maintain Oxford comma.

issue: Possessive versus plural in program name
rationale: Use singular verb with program name used as a singular entity for subject-verb agreement.

suggested_edit: allowed leaders to build trust and mitigate conflict.
rationale: No change; sentence is fine. Removing this from edits.

Compound modifier should be hyphenated per style.
